Kassiopeia  3
Monte Carlo simulation program specializing in tracking particles in electric and magnetic fields

TestArgonInteraction.cxx

16 #include "KConst.h"

23 #include "KSIntDensityConstant.h"
24 #include "KSIntCalculatorArgon.h"
25 
26 
27 #include <sstream>
28 using std::stringstream;
29 
30 using namespace Kassiopeia;
31 using namespace katrin;
32 
33 int main( int /*anArgc*/, char** /*anArgv*/ )
34 {
35  double tLowEnergy = 1;
36  double tHighEnergy = 18601;
37  double tEnergyStepSize = 1.;
38  double tLength = 1.0;
39 
40  KSIntDensityConstant* tDensityCalc = new KSIntDensityConstant();
41  tDensityCalc->SetPressure(1.e-4); // pascal (*100 for mbar)
42  tDensityCalc->SetTemperature(300.); // kelvin
43 
44  KSIntCalculator* elasticCalculator = new KSIntCalculatorArgonElastic();
45  elasticCalculator->SetName( "argon_elastic" );
46  elasticCalculator->SetTag( "argon" );
47 
48  KSIntCalculator* IonIntCalculator = new KSIntCalculatorArgonSingleIonisation();
49  IonIntCalculator->SetName( "argon_single_ionisation" );
50  IonIntCalculator->SetTag( "argon" );
51 
52  KSIntCalculator* DoubleIonIntCalculator = new KSIntCalculatorArgonDoubleIonisation();
53  DoubleIonIntCalculator->SetName( "argon_double_ionisation" );
54  DoubleIonIntCalculator->SetTag( "argon" );
55 
56  KSIntCalculator* ExcitationCalculators[25];
57  for( unsigned int i = 0; i < 25; ++i )
58  {
59  stringstream tmp;
60  tmp << (i + 1);
61  ExcitationCalculators[i] = new KSIntCalculatorArgonExcitation();
62  ExcitationCalculators[i]->SetName( "argon_excitation_state_" + tmp.str() );
63  ExcitationCalculators[i]->SetTag( "argon" );
64  static_cast< KSIntCalculatorArgonExcitation* >( ExcitationCalculators[i] )->SetExcitationState( i + 1 );
65  }
66 
67 
68  // get stuff from toolbox == fuck the toolbox
69  KSIntScattering* tScattering = new KSIntScattering();
70  tScattering->SetDensity( tDensityCalc );
71  tScattering->SetSplit( false );
72 
73  tScattering->AddCalculator(elasticCalculator);
74  tScattering->AddCalculator(IonIntCalculator);
75  tScattering->AddCalculator(DoubleIonIntCalculator);
76  for( unsigned int i = 0; i < 25; ++i )
77  {
78  tScattering->AddCalculator(ExcitationCalculators[i]);
79  }
80 
81 
82  tScattering->Initialize();
83 
84  // initialize root
85  TApplication tApplication( "Test Interaction", 0, NULL );
86 
87  TCanvas tCrossSectionCanvas( "crosssection_canvas", "cross section" );
88  TGraph tCrossSectionGraph;
89  TGraph tIonCrossSectionGraph;
90  TGraph tDoubleIonCrossSectionGraph;
91  TGraph tElCrossSectionGraph;
92  TGraph tExcitationGraphs[25];
93 
94 
95  TCanvas tEnergyLossCanvas( "energyloss_canvas", "energy loss" );
96  TH1D tEnergyLossHisto("energy loss","energy loss",400,7.,120.);
97 
98  TCanvas tScatteringAngleCanvas( "scatteringangle_canvas", "scattering_angle" );
99  TH1D tScatteringAngleHisto("scattering angle","scattering angle",200,0.,180.);
100 
101 
102  // make particles
103  KSParticle* tInitialParticle = KSParticleFactory::GetInstance().Create( 11 );
104  KSParticle* tFinalParticle = KSParticleFactory::GetInstance().Create( 11 );
105  KSParticle* tInteractionParticle = KSParticleFactory::GetInstance().Create( 11 );
106  KSParticleQueue tSecondaries;
107 
108  tInitialParticle->SetLength( 0.00 );
109  tFinalParticle->SetLength( tLength );
110 
111 
112  double tEnergy = tLowEnergy;
113  int tIndex = 0;
114  while ( tEnergy <= tHighEnergy )
115  {
116  tInitialParticle->SetKineticEnergy_eV( tEnergy );
117  tInteractionParticle->SetKineticEnergy_eV( tEnergy );
118  tFinalParticle->SetKineticEnergy_eV( tEnergy );
119 
120 
121  double tAverageCrossSection = 0.;
122  tScattering->CalculateAverageCrossSection( *tInitialParticle, *tFinalParticle, tAverageCrossSection);
123  tCrossSectionGraph.SetPoint ( tIndex, tEnergy, tAverageCrossSection );
124 
125 
126  double tCrossSection = 0.;
127 
128  IonIntCalculator->CalculateCrossSection(*tInitialParticle, tCrossSection);
129  tIonCrossSectionGraph.SetPoint( tIndex, tEnergy, tCrossSection);
130 
131  DoubleIonIntCalculator->CalculateCrossSection(*tInitialParticle, tCrossSection);
132  tDoubleIonCrossSectionGraph.SetPoint( tIndex, tEnergy, tCrossSection);
133 
134  elasticCalculator->CalculateCrossSection(*tInitialParticle, tCrossSection);
135  tElCrossSectionGraph.SetPoint( tIndex, tEnergy, tCrossSection);
136 
137  for( unsigned int i = 0; i < 25; ++i )
138  {
139  ExcitationCalculators[i]->CalculateCrossSection(*tInitialParticle, tCrossSection);
140  tExcitationGraphs[i].SetPoint(tIndex, tEnergy, tCrossSection);
141  }
142 
143  tEnergy += tEnergyStepSize;
144  tIndex++;
145 
146  mainmsg(eNormal) << "Calculating Crossections - Step: " << tIndex << " Energy: " << tEnergy << reom;
147  }
148 
149  tEnergy = 500.;
150  KThreeVector tDirection = KThreeVector(0.,0.,1.);
151  tInitialParticle->SetMomentum(tDirection);
152  tInteractionParticle->SetMomentum(tDirection);
153  tFinalParticle->SetMomentum(tDirection);
154  tInitialParticle->SetKineticEnergy_eV( tEnergy );
155  tInteractionParticle->SetKineticEnergy_eV( tEnergy );
156  tFinalParticle->SetKineticEnergy_eV( tEnergy );
157 
158  for(int i = 0; i < 100000; i++)
159  {
160  mainmsg(eNormal) << "Calculating Energylossfunction - Step: " << i << " Energy: " << tEnergy << reom;
161  double tAverageCrossSection = 0.;
162  tScattering->CalculateAverageCrossSection( *tInitialParticle, *tFinalParticle, tAverageCrossSection);
163  if(tAverageCrossSection > 0.)
164  {
165  tScattering->DiceCalculator( tAverageCrossSection );
166  tScattering->ExecuteInteraction( *tInteractionParticle, *tFinalParticle, tSecondaries);
167  tEnergyLossHisto.Fill( tInteractionParticle->GetKineticEnergy_eV() - tFinalParticle->GetKineticEnergy_eV() );
168  tScatteringAngleHisto.Fill( tFinalParticle->GetPolarAngleToZ() );
169  tFinalParticle->SetMomentum(tDirection);
170  tFinalParticle->SetKineticEnergy_eV(tEnergy);
171  }
172  }
173 
174 
175  // show plots
176 
177  tCrossSectionCanvas.cd( 0 );
178  tCrossSectionCanvas.SetLogx();
179  tCrossSectionCanvas.SetLogy();
180  tCrossSectionGraph.SetMarkerColor( kRed );
181  tCrossSectionGraph.SetMarkerStyle( 20 );
182  tCrossSectionGraph.SetMarkerSize( 0.5 );
183  tCrossSectionGraph.SetLineWidth( 1 );
184  tCrossSectionGraph.SetMinimum(1.e-24);
185  tCrossSectionGraph.SetMaximum(1.e-17);
186  tCrossSectionGraph.SetTitle( "cross section" );
187  tCrossSectionGraph.GetXaxis()->SetTitle( "Energy in eV" );
188  tCrossSectionGraph.GetYaxis()->SetTitle( "cross section in m^2" );
189  tCrossSectionGraph.GetXaxis()->SetRangeUser(1.,40000.);
190  tCrossSectionGraph.Draw( "AP" );
191 
192  tIonCrossSectionGraph.SetMarkerColor( kGreen );
193  tIonCrossSectionGraph.SetMarkerStyle( 20 );
194  tIonCrossSectionGraph.SetMarkerSize( 0.5 );
195  tIonCrossSectionGraph.SetLineWidth( 1 );
196 
197  tIonCrossSectionGraph.Draw("same");
198 
199  tDoubleIonCrossSectionGraph.SetMarkerColor( kGreen );
200  tDoubleIonCrossSectionGraph.SetMarkerStyle( 20 );
201  tDoubleIonCrossSectionGraph.SetMarkerSize( 0.5 );
202  tDoubleIonCrossSectionGraph.SetLineWidth( 1 );
203  tDoubleIonCrossSectionGraph.Draw("same");
204 
205  tElCrossSectionGraph.SetMarkerColor( kBlue );
206  tElCrossSectionGraph.SetMarkerStyle( 20 );
207  tElCrossSectionGraph.SetMarkerSize( 0.5 );
208  tElCrossSectionGraph.SetLineWidth( 1 );
209  tElCrossSectionGraph.Draw("same");
210 
211  for( unsigned int i = 0; i < 25; ++i )
212  {
213  tExcitationGraphs[i].SetMarkerColor(kYellow);
214  tExcitationGraphs[i].SetMarkerStyle(20);
215  tExcitationGraphs[i].SetMarkerSize( 0.5 );
216  tExcitationGraphs[i].SetLineWidth( 1 );
217  tExcitationGraphs[i].Draw("same");
218  }
219 
220 
221  tEnergyLossCanvas.cd( 0 );
222  tEnergyLossHisto.SetMarkerColor( kRed );
223  tEnergyLossHisto.SetMarkerStyle( 20 );
224  tEnergyLossHisto.SetMarkerSize( 0.5 );
225  tEnergyLossHisto.SetLineWidth( 1 );
226  tEnergyLossHisto.SetTitle( "energy loss" );
227  tEnergyLossHisto.GetXaxis()->SetTitle( "Energy loss in eV" );
228  tEnergyLossHisto.Draw();
229 
230  tScatteringAngleCanvas.cd( 0 );
231  tScatteringAngleHisto.SetMarkerColor( kRed );
232  tScatteringAngleHisto.SetMarkerStyle( 20 );
233  tScatteringAngleHisto.SetMarkerSize( 0.5 );
234  tScatteringAngleHisto.SetLineWidth( 1 );
235  tScatteringAngleHisto.SetTitle( "scattering angle" );
236  tScatteringAngleHisto.GetXaxis()->SetTitle( "scattering angle in degree" );
237  tScatteringAngleHisto.Draw();
238 
239 
240  tApplication.Run();
241 
242 
243  return 0;
244 }
